Arrest made in murders of women found in Saugus

Joseph Wright, 23, of Lynn (left), allegedly admitted to Canadian authorities that he slit the throats of his mother and grandmother and dumped their bodies at a Saugus elementary school. (Globe, 12:54 p.m.)

Harvard, MIT offer free online classes

The two institutions will team to launch a $60 million initiative to offer free, online, college-level courses under a joint superbrand known as edX. (Globe, 12:01 p.m.)

Man breaks into Westport daycare after daughter mistakenly locked inside

The father told police he went to pick up his daughter from Westport Country Day Preschool on Monday and found the building closed with no staff. (Globe, 12:55 p.m.)

Why teen behavior actually makes sense

Drinking hand sanitizer? Eating spoonfuls of cinnamon? These risky teen behaviors are really a matter of biology as their brains are still creating connections for decision-making, Dr. Claire McCarthy writes.
